description: On the southern tip of Gezirah Island, the hotel is a corner of paradise in central Cairo, minutes from Cairo’s business districts. Discover a haven of peace during a vacation in Egypt, and a comfortable base to rest after a successful day of business. Relax by the pool, pamper yourself in Sofitel SPA, wine and dine in our international restaurants and bars. Surrender to luxury and come for a day, a weekend, a week…or more. A stroll along the hotel’s lush riverside promenade takes you to a host of acclaimed restaurants and bars. You can take your time, enjoying the cool shade of exotic palms and breathing in the scent of hibiscus. You’ll hear the gentle sound of water lapping as you rest on a Nile-side terrace with a cool drink, and dine on international cuisine. It’s especially beautiful at dusk, when the sun sets over Cairo’s skyline and vibrant nightlife. Escape the city for a day at our secluded Cairo hotel, which feels like an exclusive Egyptian resort set in lush gardens. Take advantage of Sofitel SPA and Sofitel FIT, float in an infinity pool overlooking the Nile, unwind in a bubbling whirlpool bath… whatever you desire. Day membership includes discounts to the restaurants and bars which line the Nile-side promenade, promising refreshment and fun for families, couples and friends.

name: Dahab Hostel
amenities: Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Wifi,Board games / puzzles,Airport transportation,Rooftop terrace,24-hour security,24-hour front desk,Laundry service,Taxi service,Baggage storage,Shared bathroom,Shared kitchen,Shared lounge / TV area,Sun terrace,Non-smoking rooms
location: 26 Mahmoud Bassiouny Rooftop, 7th Floor, Talat Harb Sq, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Dahab Hostel, Your Oasis in the City... It has been open since 1998. It has been registered in all the major guidebooks and has consistently received positive reviews. Dabab Hostel is centrally located in the heart of Downtown Cairo. It is just a 3-minute-walking distance to the Egyptian Museum in Tahrir Sq., and within easy reach to the main train and bus stations. Dabab Hostel has its own special charm. It is a collection of whitewashed huts on the rooftop attempting to recreate the feel of Sinai beach camp in an unremittingly urban Downtown Cairo. Once you get inside, you will definitely sense the totally laid-back, chilled out and cozy atmosphere. The outdoor garden area is just superb for lounging around and catching up with other travelers in the evening. The breeze is refreshing and the vibe is incontestable. It is an ideal place for artistic travellers as well. Enjoy the fantastic reggae music played, laying back in the sun, smoking Shisha 'Water pipe' on the rooftop at the Bedwin corner. Sit back & relax, plan your itineraries & catch up with your family & friends by logging onto our new optimized FREE WiFi Broadband Internet coverage for the entire hostel. Our rooms are equipped withprivate facilities and A/C. We have single, double and private dorms available and there are 39 rooms in total. Airport Pickup Service Once you have made your booking, you will be contacted by a staff member to organize it with you. At the airport, you will find our representative waiting for you holding a sign of your name and Dahab hostel, after you finish passport checking and custom clearance. Things to see in the local area Shopping Bazars. Khan El-Khalili Market. Al Azhar Mosque. Old Cairo /Islamic Cairo. Coptic Area. The Citadel. Cairo Tower. Cairo Opera House. In the evenings, the local area has a wide variety of restaurants and lively nightspots. Thank you for choosing Dahab Hostel ... See you soon in Cairo... ...::: NEW :::... Check out our new Deluxe rooms with private facilities and A/C

description: Looking for a place to stay in Cairo? Then look no further than Novotel Cairo El Borg, a family-friendly hotel that brings the best of Cairo to your doorstep.Guest rooms offer a flat screen TV, air conditioning, and a minibar, and Novotel Cairo El Borg Hotel makes getting online easy as free wifi is available.You can also take advantage of some of the amenities offered by the hotel, including room service, a rooftop terrace, and a concierge. In addition, guests can enjoy a pool and free breakfast during their visit. As an added convenience, there is free parking available to guests.For those interested in checking out popular landmarks while visiting Cairo, Novotel Cairo El Borg Hotel is located a short distance from Zamalek (Gezira Island) (0.0 mi) and Mosque of Al-Azhar (1.1 mi).While you’re here, be sure to check out some of the Italian restaurants, including Vivo Restaurant, Pane Vino Restaurant, and L'Uliveto Restaurant, all of which are a short distance from Novotel Cairo El Borg.Cairo is also home to Egyptian Geology Museum, a popular science museum that is not too far from Novotel Cairo El Borg Hotel.We’re sure you’ll enjoy your stay at Novotel Cairo El Borg as you experience everything Cairo has to offer.

location: Cairo Suez Road New Administrative Capital, Cairo 29115 Egypt
description: Located in the heart of the new administrative capital, The St. Regis Almasa Hotel serves as a destination within a destination. It is the prestigious address perfectly situated to enhance the networks of state officials and the business elite as well as an exquisite escape for unparalleled family time. Here, quintessential luxury meets stately elegance. On the fast track to becoming Egypt’s epicenter of governance and commerce, the new administrative capital will play host to heads of state and their delegations, while acting as the seat of power for the country’s government. Featuring a vibrant new center of arts and culture, the capital will also attract artists and art lovers to enchanting and inspiring destinations like the stunning Grand Opera House. Also, not far off are one of the world’s most iconic ancient wonders - the pyramids.

description: Hotel Grand Royal is located in Cairo City Centre. Rooms are decorated with white colours and wooden furniture. Free Wi-Fi is available in the entire hotel. The rooms are air-conditioned with wooden flooring. Facilities include TV and bathroom with a bathtub. Some rooms have a balcony overlooking the city. Fresh flowers are sent to the rooms every day. Guests can enjoy the wide variety of restaurants located outside the hotel. Choice of food ranges from Egyptian to western dishes. The restaurant at Grand Royal is also open to guests, and room service is available as well. Guests can take a walk by the Nile River or visit the Egyptian Museum, all within 15 minutes' walking distance. The hotel is within 20 minutes' drive to Pyramids of Giza. Cairo International Airport is located within 35 minutes' driving distance.

location: 21 Mohamed Mazhar St. Zamalek, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Set on the picturesque and exclusive island of Zamalek on the magnificent waters of the River Nile, the Hilton Zamalek Residence Cairo is located in a tranquil spot between downtown Cairo and Giza and is only 12 miles from Cairo Airport. All of the luxurious guest rooms at this hotel in Cairo offer spectacular city or river views and feature modern amenities such as high-speed internet access and LCD TVs. Upgrade to an elegant suite for additional space, a kitchen, living and dining areas and terraces offering scenic Nile views. Hold a professional conference in one of 3 flexible meeting rooms, all of which feature the latest in audio/visual technology and make use of our business center. Dine on international and oriental cuisine overlooking the pool and the River Nile in Nile Breeze, listen to live music in the Tea Time Lounge and enjoy casual al fresco food and drink on the deck at Waves. Work out in the complimentary Fitness Center, swim lengths in the heated swimming pool, which features a Jacuzzi or indulge in a massage while the little ones have fun in the Children’s Play Area. Explore the Egyptian Museum, experience the exotic sights, sounds and smells of the vibrant Egyptian Bazaar, 'Khan El-Khalili' and marvel at the Great Sphinx and Pyramids at Giza.

description: Overlooking the magnificent River Nile, Conrad Cairo is set in the heart of bustling downtown. This award-winning event and business hotel offers city explorers premium rooms, elegant dining and 24-hour entertainment with a glamorous International Casino. Conrad Cairo offers spectacular River Nile views from every room. Enjoy easy access to city center businesses, as well as legendary attractions such as the Sphinx and Giza Pyramid. Extensive amenities include an on-site health club and outdoor swimming pool. Hotel boutiques, florist, beauty salon and shoe shine are also available for your convenience. Six outstanding restaurants and bars offer round the clock dining and entertainment. Visit the International Casino with a cocktail in hand and experience the glitz and glamour of Stage One bar. Our hotel is now in the TripAdvisor Hall of Fame, receiving outstanding traveler reviews and a TripAdvisor Certificate of Excellence six years in a row.

Refined luxury and service await you. 104 breathtaking tower suites, ideally located at the east bank of the River Nile, combined downtown convenience . To reach the Cairo World Trade Centre Residence from Cairo International Airport take Orouba Road and then 6th of October Bridge. Take the 15th of May Bridge exit and from there the Cornich El Nile exit (the 3rd right after you get off the bridge). Depending on traffic, expect the 12-mile drive to take 30-45 minutes.

description: A modern, family-friendly hotel in Cairo's dynamic Citystars Heliopolis In the heart of Citystars business and leisure complex and just 10 minutes from Cairo International Airport, the Holiday Inn® Cairo Citystars hotel is an ideal base for exploring the modern and historic attractions of Egypt's capital. Next to the hotel, Stars Centre Mall is home to over 640 of shops and high-tech amusements including Snow City and Magic Galaxy, Egypt's largest indoor theme park. Downtown Cairo is less than half an hour away. The hotel's family-friendly atmosphere makes everyone feel at home, from the rooftop garden with its adults' and children's swimming pools, to the Star Corner Café in the lobby. Open 24-hours, Windows Restaurant tempts diners with heaped international buffets and live cooking stations, and Indira Restaurant serves some of the best Indian food in Cairo. description: A Heavenly Retreat of Well-Being in Cairo A sanctuary of well-being amidst bustling Cairo, The Westin Cairo Golf Resort & Spa Katameya Dunes is tucked away in this fast-emerging, upscale, integrated lifestyle enclave in New Cairo, where people escape to discover a relaxing haven, offering 177 rooms & suites inside “Katameya Dunes Compound”, the city’s high-end residential compound. At The Westin Cairo Golf Resort & Spa - Katameya Dunes, every aspect of your stay is carefully designed, from our innovative programs to our revitalizing amenities, everything we do is for a better you. Surrounded by the 27 holes, Sir Nick Faldo designed, Golf Course that is configured into two Championship Golf Courses, The lake, and The Palms. The hotel relaxing facilities set the stage for an energizing stay, inviting every guest to relax and reset. The resort provides an innovative approach to well-being where guests feel they can achieve perfect balance and surrender to the healing touch of enriching experiences so that they can reach their fullest potential. The resort invites guests to a vibrant culinary journey delivered within three dining concepts; from delicious healthy to the finest international ingredients for an unforgettable sensory food experience in the city of Cairo At The Westin Cairo Golf Resort & Spa - Katameya Dunes, our mission is to enable guests to live energizing experiences for the mind, body, and spirit. Our touchpoints and initiatives are designed from our desire to allow for a better you in Cairo. From the contemporary and spacious rooms and suites featuring the iconic Westin Heavenly Bed to the latest WestinWORKOUT fitness studio, a visit to the signature Heavenly Spa, no detail is overlooked. From the moment guests arrive, they feel Westin’s essence, but combined with multicultural flavors elevated by the engaged approach of the warm Egyptian hosts who help them enjoy their stay. All associates are inspired to instinctively and thoughtfully respond to guests’ needs on a personal level. Ultimately, the revitalized travelers and loved ones leave The Westin Cairo Golf Resort & Spa - Katameya Dunes relaxed, enriched, renewed & feeling better.

description: The location was great, but there isn't much else to recommend. The rooms weren't dirty and breakfast was great, but despite requesting a single larger bed upon making the reservation, we were given two twin size beds. One of the beds was broken to the point of being basically unusable. At one point, they cleaned our room and they put wet sheets on our bed. It took a lot of work to get dry sheets from the front desk, as they seemed completely uninterested in helping us, and then we had to remake our now wet bed. Not only that, I think someone smoked in our room while cleaning it. The lobby constantly smelled strongly of cheap perfume covering up cigarette smoke. And you won't be able to sleep in as there is a school that meets outside and children chanting and a drum beating to march them to school. The value is good for location and breakfast, but I wouldn't stay here again.…

description: RUDE Security Officers.. this hotel has the worst security officials and officers . They Harass you so much when you enter the hotel . They check you and your bags . They make you walk through a metal detector . And then tell that you cannot go in, as this is for hotel people and hen you try to explain that you are staying at the hotel they won’t listen. After arguing and showing door card and wrist band .. they huff and puff .. say some Arabic words.   Then you get to hotel lob and again you get harassed and again walk through metal detectors.  Put your bags through X-ray machine .  This happens everyday and all the time . We have complainers at hotel reception and they apologised and said this will now happen again but it does and it makes you feel so uncomfortable.   The hotel is heavily surrounded by army officers too.   Not a place to take your family   You cannot bring any food or drinks from outiside as it is hotel policy .   This place is horrible and i will it be coming back .  AVOID please…

name: Ismailia House Hotel
amenities: Children Activities (Kid / Family Friendly),Laundry service
location: 1 El Tahrir Sq. Downtown, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: I love this little hotel. I often stayed there as a single woman in Cairo, and they always took good care of me! I have spent hundreds of days there over the last 30 years. I spent a lot of 2020 here, as my apartment was being renovated. The staff made me feel it was my second home.  The hotel is thoroughly cleaned every day. It was redecorated in the last couple years. The building is 1920s style, with high ceilings, balconies with great views of the city, ceiling fans, and lots of charm. The old, original elevator works well--it might take some getting used to, but it is regularly maintained, so you can count on it. If it ever does not work once, the owner gets it checked right away, because he won't be able to stay in business without it. If you find the stairways dirty or the airshaft dirty--these things are typical in Egypt and not something the hotel can do anything about, since they own the eighth floor, but not the building.  The owner, Ashraf, is very kind and accommodating to your needs, as well as an excellent source of information about any where you need to go, how to renew your visa, how to open a bank account, and whatever else you need. The staff are respectful and very honest.   Breakfast is bread, cheese and jam, plus an egg! Most budget places in Egypt don't include an egg. Cold drinks, water, tea and coffee are available at cheap prices. If you want to order a full Egyptian breakfast, it is excellent and not very expensive. Plus with the app "Talabat," you can order from hundreds of area restaurants, if you don't feel like going out. Reception staff can help you order.  There are two suites with AC and a bathroom inside. The other rooms can some with a bathroo or you share the bathrooms, but many are available and cleaned multiple times a day. The bathtubs are clean, but old. It's time to redo the porcelain on them. But they work well and are clean.  You can hang out in the reception area to meet other travelers. They are mostly students, budget travelers an occasional businessman from Saudi. If you want any tour, Ashraf can arrange it, as well as transportation wherever you want, including the airport. He is very honest, which is sometimes not easy to find in Egypt.  The location is the best! Busses and a Metro stop are right in front of you, while taxis are plentiful and not expensive. There are new Uber busses or Svwl busses or cars you can book on apps for fair prices.  The balcony views of Tahrir Square, the Egyptian Museum or the old American University of Cairo campus are fantastic.  Bring earplugs, because Cairo never sleeps, so everywhere is noisy all night.…

location: 19 Meret Basha Street, 2nd floor Tahrir Square, Cairo 99999 Egypt
description: Tahrir Plaza Suites is a boutique hotel inspired by ancient Egyptian history. The core theme of the guestrooms’ design is based on four legendary Egyptian gods (Amun-ra, Horus, Osiris & Anubis) and two goddesses (Hathor & Isis), who were worshipped with devotion during the era of the pharaohs and who also became the center point of numerous beliefs and rituals of the ancient Egyptian religion. Unlike conventional hotels, Tahrir Plaza aims to provide guests with a unique and personalized experience. It is for this reason that the hotel has only six suites, which are entirely different from each other and were carefully decorated always caring for the most minimum details such as wall colors, bed design, bathroom tiles and more.

description: Maadi Hotel is a contemporary hotel housed in one of the tallest towers in Maadi business district located about 19 miles from Cairo International Airport. Hotel offers 143 well-appointed selections of rooms and suites for business and leisure stay equally. Hotel is located in heart of the city just off Cornish El Nile – Maadi , in the hub of the business and shopping districts of Maadi. Hotel is within easy access to the Great Pyramids Of Giza & the Egyptian Museum of Cairo. Hotel features a designer outdoor pool with high-tech lounge chairs, and free Wi-Fi throughout the property. MAADI HOTEL’s guests can train at the well-equipped fitness center, or enjoy a sauna or a Steam. After a dip in the heated pool, the hot-tub is the perfect spot to relax. MAADI HOTEL offers contemporary meeting & banquet rooms which can host from 10 – 300 guests all under one roof. La Pablion restaurant offers an elegant atmosphere and international cuisine with theme nights hosted on selected days. Providing light meals and a range of pastries, the lounge cafe is open throughout the day and located at lobby level. A 24-hour room service, on site a gift shop add to the amenities offered to valued guests Cairo is also known for some great art museums, including Gayer-Anderson Museum (Bayt al-Kiritliya), The Coptic Museum, and Museum of Islamic Arts, which are not too far from Maadi Hotel. Maadi Hotel puts the best of Cairo at your fingertips, making your stay both relaxing and enjoyable.

name: Almadiafa
location: 4 Champollion Road Above Ahli United Bank, The Ninth Floor, Cairo 11556 Egypt
description: Very glad I read the reviews before going, because the entrance of the hotel was very sketchy and didn't look like a hotel.   There were no signs as to which floor to take the elevator to (8th, if you're curious), but I did recall the photos showed a rooftop hotel.   Once I got to the 8th floor, I was no longer concerned: the lobby is cute, the staff are all phenomenal and friendly and helpful, and my room had a huge balcony where I can see a partial city view.   I enjoyed my stay there, Mohammed was great, the housekeeping staff were very attentive, and I would stay there again.   They will be an amazing boutique hotel once renovations are completed and the restaurant is open!

name: The Square Boutique Hotel
amenities: Street parking,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Free breakfast,Children Activities (Kid / Family Friendly),Airport transportation,Concierge,Non-smoking hotel,24-hour check-in,Public wifi,Breakfast available,Car hire,24-hour front desk,Laundry service,Washing machine,Ironing service,Air conditioning,Housekeeping,Private balcony,Room service,Minibar,Cable / satellite TV,Electric blanket,Bidet,Seating area,Separate dining area,Telephone,Bottled water,Private bathrooms,Electric kettle,Flatscreen TV,Bath / shower,Complimentary toiletries,City view,Landmark view
location: 3 Talaat Harb Square Number 4th Floor, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: The staffs is horrible, all of them (one girl and two boys that we met) lied about everything and make no effort to speak in English. The girl from reception started to speak with us for check-in, after somebody else comes (an egyptian) and let us just like this, for 10 minute, without no information.  All of them want money from everything. They showed a book with some activities that they organize (Giza Piramids, Cairo) and when we said "thank you" politely, because we already booked, she started to do some facial expressions... The room was dirty, we found some packages near the windows... Unfortunately, I did not take some pictures. Also, they start to serve the breakfast after 9, 9.30, we said that we need to go to visit and the visits starts early in the morning, but just they don't care. It was needed me to yell to him to have the breakfast at 8.30 (an acceptable hour, after me). And, the last lie was the transfer to airport. They proposed us to get to airport and we accepted (for 250 LE - triple than the Uber). We also asked and paid one more night there till our flight (that was at 4am) because my husband twisted his ankle. We agreed with them to get us at 00.30 (so, with a lot of time in advance) from hotel. The girl told us that it takes one hour to arrive at the airport. At 23, they came to our door saying that 'the driver is already here and the way to airport is very crowded'. I said that i think it's ok because we have tine until the flight, but to be sure, we accepted to leave at 00.00. After 20 minutes, they came back and said that we need to go now because the way is blocked because of some works. They hurry us to leave the room (even if we paid the completely night). My thought is that they did not register the payment (all was cash) and all of them kept the money for one night (624 LE). And guess what, we made 20 minutes till the airport ...no trafic and no works. All was a lie just to make us leave faster. As i said before, i think that they shared the money between them.  I do NOT recomand this hotel. For us, it was an horrible experience. They ALL want just our money without making a minimum of attention to us.  Thanks, Ioana Dumitrescu…

description: This hotel is right downtown Cairo. If you are looking for cheap, lousy food and not very clean…this is the hotel for you. Our room had 3 twin size beds but the one bed was broken, the maintenance did come and fix the slats under the mattress but still not comfortable. The food upstairs for the breakfast was mostly inedible. The elevator is something from the early 20th century. The reception area is small cramped and unclean. The INTERNET is TERRIBLE. Needless to say after 2 nights booked another hotel which is lovely.

location: 4 Souk Al Tawfikiya Street 4th Floor, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: We are the exclusive Japanese Hostel in all of Cairo and Egypt.  Our standards of excellence in service and cleanliness are unsurpassed by competitively priced accommodation here in Cairo. We are the only hostel that is run by an independent joint Japanese/Egyptian venture. Our resident managers are all fluent in Japanese, Arabic and English and will be happy to give you any information that you need during and after your stay in Cairo and Egypt. High Speed Wi-Fi internet access is available free of charge. We do free airport pick up or transfer if you stay more than 3 nights with us in single or double room. Along with our excellent staff and services we offer hotel reservation. Domestic & International airfare reservation. 1st class seating train ticket reservation. Sleeper Car train ticket reservation. Tour packages with your choice of 25 different and exciting itineraries. Arrangement for Arabic lessons and classes as individual or in groups. We are only a short fifteen minute's walk from the famous Egyptian museum and Ramses railway station. Get captured by the Venice Hosokawaya hostel ... !!!!!!!!Travelers should note:@  Our hostel doesn't allow non-married males and females to stay together in the same room, however, male and female dorm rooms are available.@  Drinking of alcohol is not permitted anywhere on the hostel premises.

name: Royal Maadi Hotel
location: 11th, Road 18th, Sarayat El-Maadi, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: I spent 3 nights at the Royal Maadi Hotel (previously known as Residence Hotel). The service was the best, better than any 5 star- literally. Any issues, they come right away, the housekeeping was extremely helpful and on top of everything with personalized service, the concierge very helpful, and the reception very polite and courteous. When my daughter got stain on the walls the manager was very courteous and accommodating. They also brought for me flowers and fruit per my family's request.  I took a 3 bedroom suite which was an apartment. Each bedroom had a queen size bed. There was also a dining area, salon area, kitchen, and bathroom. The style was a bit outdated but the availability and convenience of everything made up for it. There was microwave, fridge, toaster, oven, kitchenware, ironing board, tv, and desks.   I appreciated the cleanliness- everything was covered in plastic and sanitized.   Breakfast was very basic with boiled egg, jam, bread, cheese, OJ, tea/nescafe.   Delivery is easy through talabat app where I ordered things from the pharmacy and other restaurants. The hotel is keen about safety so no delivery persons come to the room, instead the concierge will carry up the item and you give him the money. I made sure to leave a tip for both him and the person delivering.  There are also a few restaurants and cafes downstairs although I didn't try any. One is particularly famous in Maadi for breakfast called Ovio (?).  The location is quiet, removed from the hustle and bustle of Cairo, and a view of trees and greenery specific to Maadi. I loved the balcony to relax in.   I totally recommend this hotel for short or extended stay. Special thanks to Mr. Sayed the manager, Ms. Asmaa the receptionist, Ms. Heba the housekeeper, Mr. Nour/Nouh the concierge. Excellent service and help from them.…

name: Maxim Hotel
amenities: Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Room service
location: 5 El Senaah St. Off Abbas El Akkad St. Nasr City, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Central location, close to everything, but on a quiet street. The staff was very helpful and accommodating. They are renovating the hotel, so some of the rooms are brand new and spacious. Good breakfast. Has wifi. Recommended!

name: Jewel Green Mountain Hotel
location: 19 Green Mountain Buildings, Nasr Road Nasr City, Next to Queen Service Company, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Not only is the hotel bad, it's the whole customer experience, hotel facilities are horrible, food is unbelievable, staff, room, everything calls you to escape the hotel. Internet wifi does not work all the time.  Breakfast restaurant welcomes you with an awful smell. The room is unbelievable, The water in the shower is just a small drops of water. And believe me, you don’t want to sniff bathroom’s aroma. !!  The bed mattress is very old and curved which causes unbearable back pain.

name: Sun Hotel
amenities: Airport transportation,Baggage storage
location: 2 Talaat Harb Street Tahrir Square, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: I stayed for 7 nights at Sun Hotel. The place looks much better than you could expect after the photos on tripadvisor. Rooms are simple, but clean. I took a cheaper option - with no A/C and shared bathroom and it was more than ok. Bathrooms are being cleaned few times a day, the water is warm. Some of the rooms have a great view to Tahrir Square - ask, if they are available. The biggest advantage of the hotel is the location - walking distance (5 min.) from the Egyptian Museum, close to the Nile, next to the metro station. The staff can speak english and are really helpful.

name: Grand Palace Hotel
amenities: Restaurant,Children Activities (Kid / Family Friendly)

description: This place is dirty AF. 5 star reviews must be paid for. Bed sheets dirty with hair and blood 🩸 stains. Dirty walls. Couldn’t even hook my fire stick up 2 the pathetic tv. Wi-Fi is trash 🗑.  Most ppl staying here look like locals who may not have much money. Didn’t even bother with breakfast since the room was dirty. Staff entered my room to fix some broken lights right when trying to eat dinner. Got bit up by something that left nasty marks. Book airbnb instead for ur stay and tours.

C’est un hôtel nouvellement créé, il a ouvert ses portes en Juillet 2020 , il appartient à l’Etat   On était très bien accueillis moi et ma petite famille. Ils nous ont donné une suite composée de 2 chambres chacune avec télé et climatisation  il y’a aussi une kitchenette et une douche  La literie est confortable et l’hôtel dispose d’un restaurant qui offre une variété de plats  Le prix est très intéressant  L’emplacement est aussi intéressant   Je recommande vivement cet hôtel

The owner and the staffs (Ms Wafa and Mr. Amun) of the hotel were very friendly.  Rooms and the building were ole and very basic, bathroom had hot water. Clean room/bathroom. Breakfast was provided.

name: Nile Sky Suites Hotel

description: Rooms are big with a great view. Friendly staff. I stayed there twice. Breakfast box was ready at 5 am as I had two early departures. Wifi is a bit slow. For this room rate you can't get a better view. Also good location on the river and close to Tahrir Square.

Worst hotel in Egypt . Don’t ever book there or waste your time with them.

name: Nitocrisse Hotel
amenities: Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Wifi,Free breakfast,Baggage storage,Shared lounge / TV area,Private check-in / check-out,Laundry service,Ironing service,Restaurant,Breakfast in the room,Allergy-free room,Air conditioning,Housekeeping,Room service,Clothes rack,Wake-up service / alarm clock,Kitchenette,Suites,Family rooms
location: 171 Mohamed Farid St Downtown, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Nitocrisse Hotel is located down town Cairo. The location places you in the heart of Cairo. All the touristic attractions are in the vicinity or effortlessly within reach from the Hotel. The Egyptian museum is a 10-minute walk, Islamic Cairo is the same distance, and the railway station is two kilometers far. The Tahrir square where you can pick any transportation means to all touristic sites is also a 10-minute Walk.Our small 45-room hotel is located on the 5th and 6th floors with four efficiently operating lifts. The hotel was established in 1955 and since then we have been trying to offer a service typical of a small family business. Our residents normally get quickly familiar with our friendly personnel who are keen on offering the best they could with respect to cleanliness and room service. We also have our homey kitchen and chef trained and experienced in Egyptian, oriental recipes together with well-known French and Italian dishes. Our dishes are competent price-wise compared to many of the nearby classical restaurants. For those who might not be interested in eating in the hotel, there are plenty of varied choices ranging between classical restaurants and more economic coffee-shops and chains, many of which are at a short walking distance-between 3 to 5 minutes . Amenities include restaurant, room service, 24 hour front Desk, lift/elevator, Air conditioned rooms, TV, laundry service...etc.

The restaurant, open 24 hours, has an oriental sitting area, a water fountain and a billiard table free for the guests.

description: Hôtel réservé via Booking. Emplacement bien mais hôtel minable, immeuble en travaux, ascenseur qui fait peur, personnel minable.

name: Stay Inn Hotel - Cairo
location: 49 Syria Street Mohandessin, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: سعت بتواجدي في هذا الفندق الرايع واكثر من رايع من حسن المعالمه والاستقبال وجودته ونظافته ومن موظفين الاستقبال بالترحيب الحارررر جدا  واتمنى ان اكرر زيارتي لي هذا الفندق الرائع قريب واشكر الاستاذ مصطفى والاستاذه مارينا  على الترحيب والابتسامه واللطافه ولا انسى المدير الكبير الاستاذ حازم على اهتمامه بالعملاء   وشكرا لكم جزيل واتمنى يجيهم خطاب شكرا  اخوكم عبدالله الزهراني من السعوديه

name: Capital Hotel Cairo
location: Behlar Passage Building Number 1, From Kasr Al Nile St., First Floor Downtown, Cairo 99999 Egypt
description: This has been another good choice for this trip!   A local friend helped me find it.  Staff are GREAT!   EXCELLENT ENGLISH,  friendly quick & thorough responses to requests.   The lobby & rooms are kept neat and clean & comfortable.  My Room was super quiet due to thick walls and being in the center of the building.  Location is also solo perfectly situated.   10 min walk from Cairo Museum,  3 min walk to Jazz restaurant.... Excellent local take away.... It's where the locals eat.    I would stay here again and do highly recommend it.  Brian

name: City Hotel
amenities: Paid public parking on-site,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Restaurant,Bicycle rental,Evening entertainment,Free airport transportation,Business Centre with Internet Access,Massage,Car park,Internet,Breakfast available,Breakfast in the room,Snack bar,Airport transportation,Car hire,Taxi service,Salon,BBQ facilities,Baggage storage,Concierge,Currency exchange,Gift shop,Mosquito net,Newspaper,Shared lounge / TV area,ATM on site,24-hour front desk,Express check-in / check-out,Private check-in / check-out,Dry cleaning,Laundry service,Ironing service,Shoeshine,Air conditioning,Desk,Housekeeping,Private balcony,Coffee / tea maker,Minibar,Electric blanket,Bath / shower,Room service,Safe,Seating area,Telephone,Wardrobe / wardrobe,Clothes rack,Laptop safe,Wake-up service / alarm clock,Electric kettle,Complimentary toiletries,Hair dryer
location: 162 El-tahrir st., Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: The City Hotel is situated in the center of Cairo, less than a 1-minute walk from the Egyptian Museum and Tahrir Square. In addition to convenient restaurants such as KFC or the famous oriental restaurant Felfela, several banks, embassies, and Metro stations are all within walking distance. The property is within a 5-minute walk to the Jewish temple and many other places of worship. The hotel offers elegant rooms with free Wi-Fi and has a restaurant that serves regional cuisine. For the comfort of the guests' room at this hotel is air conditioned and comes with a TV with satellite channels, a mini-bar, and a safety deposit box. Each room has a private bathroom fitted with a shower. All rooms at the hotel feature a city-view balcony. A complimentary breakfast is served daily which includes fresh fruits, vegetables, cheeses, breads, and eggs cooked to order. With a little advance notice upon your arrival, trips to destinations that you chose (according to a schedule of your choosing) can be arranged. Laundry service is also provided upon request. You will find a 24-hour front desk at the property. Khan Al Khalili is 1 km from the City Hotel, while Muizz Street is 2 km away. The nearest airport is Cairo International Airport, 16 km away.

name: Gamaleya Boutique Hotel
location: 14 Street Amir El Geyoush, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: This lovely hotel is a hidden gem just inside the walls of the old part of Cairo. This is where you will immediately feel you are part of Cairo street life with all its amazing colour and energy in a way you never would in one of the smart hotels in the modern part of Cairo. The minute you walk out of the door you will be in the vast ancient souk full of life and colour. The building used to be a soap factory which the owner discovered in ruins and has built into a delightful boutique hotel. It’s a true community enterprise because on the ground floor are artisan craftspeople working in separate little workshops - silversmiths, weavers, woodworkers etc- you can enjoy watching them at work and buy their beautiful creations if you like. The staff are absolutely lovely - nothing us too much trouble for them. This place feels more like a home than a hotel. Highly recommended!…

name: Richmond House Hostel
amenities: Paid public parking on-site,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Coffee shop,Children's television networks,Pets Allowed ( Dog / Pet Friendly ),Airport transportation,Salon,Baggage storage,Street parking,Breakfast in the room,Shuttle bus service,Car hire,Convenience store,Currency exchange,Gift shop,Newspaper,Outdoor furniture,Shared kitchen,Shared lounge / TV area,Shops,ATM on site,24-hour front desk,Express check-in / check-out,Dry cleaning,Laundry service,Ironing service,Housekeeping,Room service,Safe,Bottled water
location: 41 Sherif Basha, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: This hotel was a discovery for me! I originally booked a neighbor hotel, but when I arrived there at 3:00 AM they told me they were overbooked and had no room for me. Richmond House was the closed one, so I popped up without a reservation and the manager on reception was more than helpful. He only had one room available for just one night, so he let me take it with a good rate. He advised me to check again next day, and luckily they had a cancellation, so I continued my stay in another room.  Both rooms were clean, nicely furnished in a traditional style. Beds were very comfortable. Hot water was always available. Cleaning lady was doing a great job. All staff I met were super friendly and went out of their way to assist.  The location is convenient. If you walk out from the building, you will find many places to eat - from street vendors and fast food chain (KFC is 5 minutes walk) to decent restaurants. Tahrir Square and Egyptian Museum are around 15 minutes walk.  I definitely recommend this hotel for a budget stay!…

name: Jewel Maadi Cabins and Club
location: Corniche El Nil Road in front of Maadi Star Towers, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Do not expect 4* hotel, room is poor furniture is old with new paint, good view, room is clean but bathroom is wet, swimming pool opening to 4PM and then training started ,staff was helping but not professional.

location: 8 Talaat Harb Square, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Miramar Talaat is a boutique hotel in heart of cairo downtown completely new, Located within 0.5 km of Tahrir Square and 0.4km of The Egyptian Museum, Miramar Talaat Harb provides rooms and suites and family rooms for up to 5 guests. free WiFi. 1.5 km from Cairo Tower, the property is also 2.7 km away from Khan Al Khalili. The hotel has a terrace and Nice Dining area with a panoramic view over the square and a 24-hour front desk. All guest rooms in the hotel are equipped with a electric tea pot. The rooms include air conditioning, a closet and a flat-screen TV, and most units at Miramar have a balcony. A continental breakfast is served each morning at the property. Al-Azhar Mosque is 3.2 km from the accommodation. The nearest airport is Cairo International Airport, 18.5 km from Miramar Talaat Harb.

name: Abdeen Palace Hotel
amenities: Free parking,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Wifi,Free breakfast,Bar / lounge,Children Activities (Kid / Family Friendly),Airport transportation,Room service
location: 2 Sabry Abo Alam Street, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Abdeen palace hotel is ideally located in the hub of downtown cairo. Within the vicinity are a number of restaurants and cafes that describe the authentic Egyptian atmosphere. Nearby is the Abdeen Palace itself (5 min. walk) and the Egyptian Museum (10 min. walk). The rooms are comfy and cosy, they bring home away from home.

name: Nile Villa Hotel
location: 8 8 Abd El-Aal Helmy Basha, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: La struttura è un vero e proprio hotel ( non come altri che occupano solo dei piani di alcuni edifici) e ha una bella terrazza per le colazioni proprio sul Nilo. La camera era abbastanza spaziosa con due letti comodi (col piumino imbottito). Non aveva balcone ma 2 finestre vista fiume. La posizione è  abbastanza vicina al centro ma fuori dal traffico quindi, tranne per un pochino di rumore dell'aria condizionata si dorme benissimo.  Il bagno è rifatto da poco, quindi moderno anche se con qualche piccola pecca. Forniscono solo il sapone ma danno le ciabattine. La colazione viene servita in una terrazzina proprio sul fiume, con tanto di ventilatore. E' una colazione egiziana solo salata con dei falafel e le omelette cotte al momento, formaggio, verdure, pane egiziano e the o caffè. Il personale è stato molto gentile, ci hanno accolto a notte fonda e l'autista che è venuto a prenderci all'aeroporto ( per 18 euro) è stato molto cordiale con un'ottima guida. Zona tranquilla. Certamente ci vuole un po' di spirito di adattamento, perchè la pulizia non è proprio agli standard che ci si aspetta e alcuni mobili sono un po' malandati (o coperti di cellophane, non so perchè!) ma in generale per il prezzo che ha ritengo sia una buona scelta di fascia  economica.…

name: Horizon Nile Tower Hotel
location: 20 Aesha Al Taymorya, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: After amazing stay in Cairo with great people everywhere, we have booked a queen room with a private spa and private balcony to finish our stay with a nice stay on the Nile. The owner asked us to do the check-in in the ground floor, to pay (we trusted him) then to go the 20th floor to see our room. When we arrived to the 20th floor, the construction works were juste beside our room (photos attached). There was no private spa in the room and we need to cross the construction works to reach the "common" balcony ... We refused the room, and asked about something else, he told us that was the last room he has ... So we asked to cancel the reservation and to refund us the 140 € that we have just payed. The owner accepted and told us that he will refund us the full amount. Now one month later, the owner didn't refund us anything, he didn't answer my messages, my calls and my emails. We asked Booking. com to intervene, but Booking couldn't do anything as the owner asked us to pay by card in the hotel when we arrived, Booking considered the paiement has been done directly with the hotel. What a shame to have such an hotel in the "Preferred Partners Properties" Programmes of Booking.com. It is a real scam, the owner is not honest, what a shame for the nice Egyptian people to have such a scammer.…

name: Ambiance Cairo Hotel
location: 22 Talaat Harb Street Down Town, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Simply the worst hotel I’ve stayed at in 40 years. The only concern they had about me as their customer was the payment. But they couldn’t even handle a credit card machine. Well, one of the very unprofessional staff could but only after three days of my visit and when the machine was finally charged and could accept US Dollars, not Egyptian pounds (which worked everywhere else with my card). That was the start when arrived late first night. The room didn’t look ready at all, no toilet papers, no safety box, the mini bar was totally empty, no balcony as the description lied about. When I woke up it was even worse. Easily the dirtiest hotel ever. The bedclothes were ripped, had dirty stains AND pubic hair all over (in the shower as well). Smashed mosquitos/bugs on the walls, and the windows behind the curtains, jeez, I got almost sick only by looking how dirty they were. See picture. No organization whatsoever when it comes to clean up the room, if you don’t ask them nothing happens. After three days one of the staff asked me to change room since ”I’ve got a friend coming over”. Well, what about NO my friend I answered. The electricity went out about five times during my week, oh, and I left this horrible place in complete darkness since the lights went when I was just about to leave. Fawlty Towers, please come back, everything is forgiven!…

name: The Emerald Hostel
location: 34 Abdel Khalik Sarwat St, Downtown, Cairo 22222 Egypt
description: Las fotos no se corresponden con la realidad. Cuando inauguraron puede que fuera así, pero ahora esta en mal estado de conservación y muy muy sucio.  No hacen las habitaciones durante la estancia. No cierran las ventanas y entran un montón de mosquitos. Están los cadáveres en las paredes pegados porque no limpian. Matamos unos 15 y todavia nos picaron 15 más. El desayuno muy muy pobre. Los encargados del hotel se unieron a la fiesta de una de las habitaciones y aun pidiéndoles que queríamos dormir pasaron de nosotros y estuvieron toda la noche de risas y música alta. No descansamos nada.

name: Downtown Inn
amenities: Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Wifi,Hot bath,Free breakfast,Children Activities (Kid / Family Friendly),Airport transportation,Laundry service,Room service
location: 42 Talaat Harb Street, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Unbeatable location, spotless clean room and bath, extremely hospitable hosts - I couldn't ask for more! I checked in late (around 11pm) and it was a smooth process - thanks to Mr. Umar - one of the hosts. Mr. Umar is always happy to share words of wisdom from his decades of experience and I really appreciate all the food and travel tips I got from him! Mr. Ibrahim, the other host is a resourceful and energetic young man. This cool dude gave me loads of tour options (even for other cities like Aswan and Luxor), helped me exchange currency, arranged transportation. Between them and the very helpful Moustafa and Mary there's always someone at front desk, eager to assist.  There's a ton to do around this area. One can walk over to the the Museum, Tahrir Square, Nasr Metro Station, Bo Bus station or the Nile in about 10 minutes. My room was surprisingly quiet considering the busy location! The railway station is about 1km away. Countless shopping and food options in the neighborhood - from touristy to very local stuff!  The general vibe at the hotel is very welcoming, laid back and casual. They serve breakfast and even offered to customize it for me. There's a shared kitchen and plenty of seating in the lobby. The wifi is not the best, though it was being hogged by a few guests streaming videos all day. I found an unused wifi router in the hallway and set it up as a range extender. The hosts were immensely grateful!  Made some great connections with the hosts and fellow travelers as I lounged about the lobby, sipping some of their amazing shaay :) Special mention for Ahmed - the dashing young man who drove me all around Cairo, Giza, dropped me to the train station and even invited me for a home-cooked meal! Mr. Omar and Ibrahim are ambassadors of Egyptian hospitality. They made me feel like a guest and not a customer. It was almost too good to be true! They actually convinced me to return to Egypt! I'll certainly stay again at Mr. Umar and Mr. Ibrahim's place…

The Guest House offers communal spaces to socialize with fellow travelers from around the world, as well as private bathrooms on each floor. Enjoy a drink and a bite to eat while you soak up the unparalleled view of the Giza Plateau from our rooftop terrace. description: The hotel is very centrally located, near Attaba metro station. name: Kmt Hostel
location: 8 Gawad Housny 3rd Floor, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: I chose KMT Hostel since I needed a cheap place to sleep for one night in Cairo.  It's well located - I walked there from the bus station.  There are restaurants nearby and the metro is close.   My bunk bed was comfortable and roomy, though I suspect the room gets crowded when all the beds are taken.  The bunk has a personal plug, light and a shelf.  Bathroom was clean with good showers.   I left early, so didn't try the breakfast.  The hotel owner was my taxi driver to the airport, very easy.  I wish there was an indoor lounge with no smoking allowed. FYI there is no outdoor space, which would be a pain for a longer visit.  Front desk staff seems hit or miss.

name: Cairo International Hostel Downtown
location: 9 Adly 5th floor, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Commençons par les points positifs… ou plutôt l’unique point positif : la localisation en plein cœur du centre ville, idéal pour rayonner à pieds, voiture, ou métro. L’arrivée à « l’hôtel » se fait par l’une des artères principales du cente-ville, ou par une petite ruelle au charme « coupe-gorge », si vous arrivez du mauvais côté. Arrivés en bas du bâtiment, nous n’avons trouvé aucune indication/pancarte confirmant la présence de l’établissement, et c’est grâce aux avis laissés sur différents sites que nous nous sommes rendus au 5eme étage pour le check-in. Prenant possession de notre chambre, nous avons pu constater que les draps étaient sales (présence de nombreuses tâches et cheveux/poils de précédents occupants, Cf photos). Malgré tout, et fatigués d’une intense journée, nous nous sommes empressés d’aller nous coucher et avons immédiatement noté l’absence totale d’insonorisation, résultant en une charmante nuit blanche. Le centre-ville du Caire ressemble à un gigantesque cortège de mariage avec ses coups de klaxons incessants de 6h à 1h30, s’en suivent les aboiements des chiens errants de 1h30 à 4h30-5h et enfin l’appel à la prière. Autant dire si vous aspirez à passer une nuit paisible, un autre établissement avec un minimum d’insonorisation sera tout indiqué. Pour passer le temps durant ces nombreuses heures à tourner et retourner dans notre lit, nous avons été gratifiés de multiples démangeaisons ne laissant guère de doute sur leur origine : de belles piqûres en rang d’oignons témoignant de la présence de punaises de lit plutôt voraces. Si vous êtes malgré tout tentés de séjourner dans ce lieu immonde, assurez-vous que votre gabarit vous permette de profiter des toilettes sans vous cogner dans le mur se trouvant face à vous (idéal pour travailler un mouvement de squats bien vertical). Attention également aux bouteilles d’eau fournies par l’établissement qui sont en réalité des bouteilles de récupération remplies à la fontaine : si la tourista vous effraie, nous vous recommandons plutôt de vous approvisionner à l’épicerie située au bout de la petite ruelle précédemment évoquée. En résumé, à fuir ! Le tarif, même bas, ne suffit pas à occulter tous les aspects négatifs de ce lieu que je n’oserais qualifier d’hôtel, d’hostel ni même de refuge.…

name: Cairo House
location: 20 Adly, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: We faced a problem while accommodating that our room has been reserved twice even if i have received a confirmation from the property and they messaged me that i have to arrive before 6:00 pm. They say to us that no room available after our arrival and they will transfer us to another place with same price!!!

name: Columbia Hotel
location: 42 Talaat Harb, Cairo 11562 Egypt
description: The central location is positive.  The rest is negative. It's more like Airbnb with a reception on the 6th floor of a run-down building.  There is smoking at the reception, which you can smell in the front rooms. The furniture is yellowed, there are scratches on the wood.  Everything makes a loveless and unkempt impression.  Without ventilation, the rooms are fine. Even a window was broken. Breakfast only on demand and normally only from 9. Then it takes half an hour.  Who wants to leave early for the sights should wake up early and hope that e. g. a guy from the reception “feels able” to prepare some breakfast (which was always bread, cheese, foul, a salad that’s all).  Maybe it’s a place for a solo traveler man but not for someone with a western standard.

name: Columbia Sky City Hotel
location: 13 13 Adly, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Went to check-in, the rooms were apart from each other (insane Egyptian rule regarding mixed couples who can't stay together) and one of the rooms was near the reception (like ten centimeters away from the desk and therefore, a person) with zero privacy or anything so they could keep an eye on us. Or how to casually remove your freedom. We canceled our stay, they said they were going to refund us and then never did. Don't recommend it at all.

When I arrived, they said they have no room and would give me a room in a sister property which looked much worse. I asked them if they can organize a stay in a nicer hotel and they refused. Just to make sure: I had a confirmed reservation, just saying this again! Also, the lobby looks not even close to what they show online. Avoid at all cost.

name: Sun Smile Hotel
location: 133 Omar Ibn El Khattab St. Heliopolis, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Такого ужаса я еще не видела. Когда мы приехали было темно, особо не разглядела. Но с утра начался кошмар. Убирают в отеле отвратительно. Кормят так же как и убирают. На второй день я отравилась рыбой. Оказывается ее подали, она была уже испорченной. Два для я обнимала унитаз. После это я есть в местном ресторане не могла. На территории отеля есть русский ресторанчик, который меня и спас. Потому что оставшийся отпуск я питалась за свои деньги там. Анимация ужасная. Через пяти минут я ушла спать. За территорией отеля обстановка не очень, грязно, мусор, брошенная стройка. Из отеля лучше не выходить. Персонал отвратительный.

description: Regent House is comfortable clean and peaceful hotel that offers privet, double, triple and shared rooms and accommodate groups of up to 35 guests. All rooms are big, clean and spacious with balcony with air condition or fans and reading light with privet path ensuite with hot showers.You will get so much more than just a good nights sleep at an affordable price that we don't only provide excellent facilities, but also have a warm and welcoming atmosphere.Staff:Our friendly staff is on hand to answer your queries 24 hours .they can speak fluent English and ready to help you any way and any time at 24hours reception.Travel Desk:We are not an amateur but professional organization and well known around Cairo. If you are looking for a quiet and comfortable place to have some rest and relax this hostel will be a very good choice.Don’t believe any body tell you any thing about us or we are closed or not available please call us when you arrive to airport.Accommodation InformationWe offer free pick-up from the air portRegent House is comfortable clean and peaceful hotel that offers private, double, triple and shared rooms that accommodate groups of up to 35 guests. All rooms are big, clean and spacious with balcony with air-conditioning or fans and reading light with private bath ensuite with hot showers.You will get so much more than just good nights sleep at an affordable price that we don't only provide excellent facilities, but also have awarm and welcoming atmosphere.Location InformationWe are located in the best impressive area in the heart of the most famous city in Africa you can find us easily down town beside famous shopping centers and famous restaurant closed to Egyptian museum , that we are just:-5 minutes from Egyptian museum -10 minutes from Cairo gateway -10 minutes from Ramses station-15 minutes from khan el khalili - AL Hussien Mosque - We are in city center on Talat harb street where you can move to any place you like to visit.

name: Ultra Trans Hotel
location: Nile Corniche, Shubra Al Kheimah In front of Mohamed Ali Palace, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: We have chosen this hotel because in order to be in Shobra and also because of the perfect view from the rooms. There is terrace facing the Nile River directly. Unforgettable atmosphere for drinking coffee in the morning or having lunch in the afternoon. Breakfast is fine, every day the same, but you can choose for yourself whatever you want.  Room is comfortable, clean, spacious. It was not cold beside the Nile during our stay. They provide water and coffee/tea facilities in the room.   The territory is not big and it is actually not for walking or staying whole day. There are swimming pools (we did not use), bars in open area. Parking is free and located underground.  They provide food to the room by the menu - prices are affordable like at any normal restaurant outside.   In general - good hotel to stay if you need to be in this area and plan to spend whole day outside the hotel.…

name: Horizon Nile Plaza Hotel
location: 67 Abdulaziz Al Saud Al Manial, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Horizon Nile Plaza Hotel is maybe not easy to find, because it within a skyscraper, but once you are in the room, we got more than expected. The rooms are very clean and spaces, and the view over Cairo is really nice. Also, the breakfast, which is served on the room, is a nice Egyptian breakfast, which is alright. Near by the hotel you find some nice restaurants, so no need for a long walk or ride. Also, a small supermarket is round the corner. All in all, we a good hotel especially on a value for money ratio, we would definitely come again.  Room service was not existent, so they didn´t clean the rooms during our whole stay (7 nights). Thank god we brought shower gel, as well as a hairdryer. As usual in that city, the rooms a bit noisy. If you have rooms to the east side, there are mosques quite close, the north and west side are better.…

name: Green Garden Inn
location: 1086 Nile Corniche, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: The Green Garden Inn rescued us after a horrible experience where we had arrived in Cairo - at night, in the dark, with children - to discover that our hotel booked through Booking.com was full and couldn't offer us a room.  The Green Garden Inn staff were absolutely fantastic - so friendly, helpful, smiley and kind.  Our kids had a great time watching the football in the Reception.  Breakfast was very good - lots of choice.  The hotel is located in a quiet, safe area - 15 minute walk from Tahir Square where there are lots of restaurants.  Would highly recommend.

name: Grand Nile Royal Hotel at Nile Plaza
location: 1085 Corniche El-Nile - Garden City, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: The hotel is close to the center and you are able to walk in 15-20 min to Egyptian museum and some other attractions. The rooms were clea and relaxing. We were close to reception and Internet connection worked well during the time we were in.  The staff was lovely at reception and the breakfast was amazing as well (it looked pretty simple at first sight, but then we discovered the fresh omelet and other things. You get a kettle in the room and a few tea bags, but no bottles water like in other places around the country.  There is a car park on the premises, but is hard to locate it when first arriving, so we ended up in a local car park by the buildings near by.  Depending on the floor your stay, you might have a different view of the Nille. The great part is that you have a close balcony were you can stay and relax watching the craziness of the city.…

description: This is a 2 Star hotel. It’s located in Giza which is suppose to be a nice area of Cairo. While the staff are friendly and helpful the place is very noisey, the beds are hard as rocks and the showers don’t have much water pressure and that’s if you can get hot water at all. I stayed here as a part of a basic tour booking so I suppose I got what I paid for - $46AUD per night. I was here three times throughout the tour and each room had the same issues. It is close to a pharmacy and some local clean restaurants and if you are only staying a night or two it would be ok, any longer and I’d recommend something a bit better.

name: Regency Hotel
amenities: Children Activities (Kid / Family Friendly)
location: 3 Abdel Azim Rashed St., Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: The Regency Hotel in Cairo is located in the Giza suburb of Dokki a fair walk from downtown Cairo on the west bank of the Nile, aka the crappy side. It is off a busy highway & around the corner from a ladies club. If this doesnt raise your suspicions about this being the wrong Regency Hotel perhaps the hand painted hotel sign will.  Room 506 has seen better days about a decade ago. After enjoying the release of emptying my bowels the toilet wouldnt flush & there wasnt any toilet paper. There was a 28cm tv, mini fridge & aircon. Bedsheets looked sort of gungy & the carpet was fairly dirty. The reception dudes spoke little english but knew how to ask for tips. I played a game of charades with them to try & explain the toilet problem. It was very entertaining, we eventually changed rooms to an equally poor room.  The hotel is housed in the sort of neighbourhood you would go to if you were homeless. Stray dogs & garbage are the main features here if you like to take photos. There are no computers in the hotel, the reception desk used paper & pen! The 80's has come back in fashion here.  The hotel resturant has cobbwebs on the locked door, this is probably not good so avoid even asking for food, just call KFC for takeaway 19019.  The previous review from 2 years ago basically describes our experience word for word, so in 2 years nothing had improved, indeed its pretty shabby. If you stayed here, have a sense of humour & laugh.…

name: Logistic City Stars Hotel
location: 99 El-Nasr Road, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Loin des standards d'un 1* encore moins d'un 5*  Pour avoir séjourné dans différents hôtels à travers le monde, je peux vous dire qu'ils doivent tout apprendre dans ce domaine.  Le personnel n'est pas du tout souriant et très peu aimable. Très loin de l'hospitalité africaine. L'accueil est inexistant.   Première fois en 15 ans que je tombe sur un hôtel aussi médiocre.  Scandaleux et honteux de mettre des descriptions non conformes.  1/ À quelques heures de s'enregistrer (une fois que l'annulation n'est plus possible) on reçoit un mail pour nous signaler que l'hôtel n'est réservé qu'aux égyptiens et que les nourritures et boissons extérieures sont complètement interdites dans l'enceinte. Aucuns de ces points n'aient signalés lors de la réservation ou sur le descriptif en ligne.  2/ Surprise au moment de s'enregistrer, le prix bloqué à la réservation à augmenté de 15% et l'hôtesse nous apprend qu'on doit ajouter 60$ à ce prix car nous sommes non résidents égyptiens.  DES VOLEURS!!   Face à notre refus d'ajouter autant elle baisse la somme de 70% en quelques secondes (taxe à la tête du client!!! Honteux !  3/ Ils proposent soit disant des chambres doubles mais au moment de découvrir la chambre on s'aperçoit qu'elle est avec 2 lits simples, on appelle l'accueil pour signaler que ce n'est pas ce que nous avions réservés. L'hôtesse nous répond simplement que dans cet hôtel toutes les chambres sont en lits séparés.   4/ La chambre est sommaire.   Odeur d'humidité et marque d'humidité sur les murs   Quant à la literie, elle n'est pas du tout confortable.  Juste une serviette de toilette, pas de serviettes pour les mains, cheveux ou même de tapis de bain... Pas de câble TV, uniquement les chaînes locales...  5/ Petit déjeuner inexistant,   même pas de café ou de lait, juste une bouilloire d'eau chaude, obligé d'aller se restaurer à côté pour avoir quelques choses de convenable à se mettre sous la dent. Déplorable  6/ Piscine non accessible à convenance car utiliser pour des entraînements  Enfin, vous l'aurez compris et êtes prévenus, à fuir !…

location: 37 Kasr Al Nile Down Town, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Located at the top of a multipurpose building it’s not what you might expect from an Inn. The entrance is somewhat hidden in an alley. The entrance hall is, say the least, weird. The elevator will not pass any European security check, but remember you’re in Egypt. Their many gods will probably protect your journey up to the actual Inn, where an informal welcome awaits you. Your host Khaled and his twin sister will show you every courtesy one could expect. Your wish is his / their command. Like a real Egyptian genie he will bring you at the most impossible of hours a cool forbidden drink combined with the latest gossip about his vast family. Charming, entertaining, it makes you feel at home. Our room was clean and decorated Egyptian style. The bathroom was the same, however, Egyptian style in case refers to the way it was constructed. It all worked but a sense of humor was needed. In short, a nice, hospitable place with limits for a short stay at the city centre, close to King Tut. Service with a wonderful smile.…

description: Hotel is located on one floor of a renovated old building.  A bit tired-looking, but with a lot of the original charm and art deco style.  The location is near the Metro and Khan Al-Khalil bazaar, and not far from the Egyptian Museum.  The immediate neighborhood is interesting to walk in, but not many restaurants nearby.  The front desk staff was friendly and helpful, and we arranged a tour of the pyramids through them (which was excellent).  They can arrange all sorts of tours, including overnights to other Egyptian cities, and the prices were comparable to what we found online.  The shower was decent, with hot water.  Wifi was just ok, but from reading other reviews, Wifi in Cairo isn't generally great.

amenities: Free parking,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi),Free breakfast,Airport transportation,Baggage storage,Currency exchange,24-hour front desk,Dry cleaning,Wifi,Breakfast in the room,Shuttle bus service,Car hire,Non-smoking hotel,Shared kitchen,Shared lounge / TV area,ATM on site,Laundry service,Ironing service,Air conditioning,Safe,Coffee / tea maker,Microwave,Bath / shower,Hair dryer,Family rooms
location: 34 Talaat Harb Street 2nd Floor., Cairo, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Fairly clean, very nice staff. The AC worked, internet was decent. As a solo female, I felt very safe. I also had no problems walking around alone in the neighbourhood. The location is good. There are many restaurants nearby. It’s very convenient for the old Egyptian museum. The hotel is quite small.   You can book activities through them. The Cairo activities were overpriced but delivered okay services. I booked the Nile dinner cruise in Cairo, a Giza pyramid tour and a 4 day Aswan/Luxor cruise.The guides were not always very thorough and I never knew what was coming next.   DO NOT book Aswan/Luxor activities through them.  I paid almost double what other people on the cruise paid(use visitor it was legit and a good price). My guides were not great and they were frequently trying to scam me. They didn’t provide tour guides at more than 3 temples where I had thought I had paid for them. They didn’t tell me in advance so I wasn’t able to make alternative arrangements.   If you are looking for a cheap, safe, no frills place to hang out in Cairo, then it’s good. If you are looking for a hotel to help you book activities, I would recommend spending the money on a reputable hotel with dedicated staff for tours or finding a tour agency. Other people on my cruise booked it through the boat or website and paid half the price and got twice as much.…

name: Prime Select Kattameya
location: Cairo - Katameya Road, Cairo 11511 Egypt
description: Really nice and convenient place for a medium to long term stay you would definitely feel at home staying there. The apartment is located in a gated and very secure compound very well located. 15min away from Maadi. There is a qupermarket down the compound if needed. The apartment comes fully fitted with all amenities except washing machine. The host Ahmed is really nice and super reactive, if you have any issues he will be there to help day or night. Only point i had flagged during my stay were some internet connection issues which was solved after 2 days and a bit more cleanliness of the apartment before handing over to the guest ( properly vacuuming and  changing the bedsheets and towels). Apart from this you will feel righr at home! Would definitely recommend and come back :)

It was converted into the 1920's Boutique Hotel which is situated in a central and beautiful area of Korba. It incorporates a blend of the finest restaurants such as Carlo's, The Smokery, IL Divino and Ocea to name but a few and this makes it a destination that provides an outstanding and private atmosphere, that can satisfies all tastes. Just the place you need to enjoy a special “retro” taste. The Hotel combines a variety of stylish and luxurious twin & king size rooms plus one king size suite with a mix of traditional and old world charm and in room facilities.

Breakfast starts at 07:00 but it is also possible to arrange it much earlier in case you need to catch a flight. This hotel offers possibilities to use its balcony with a nice view over a part of Zamalek. Next to this hotel there is both a big supermarket (Sunny) and a place to eat, Rooms are cleaned every day and people at this hotel make sure you have a good stay and it is suitable for families as well.

name: Zamalek Suites

Wi-Fi funziona benissimo.Grazie . Quando ritorniamo a Cairo sicuramente soggiorniamo qua.

description: A 45-acre Olive Farm located on the hills of Tunis Village in Fayoum overlooking Lake Qarun. Fayoum is a beautiful and diverse part of Egypt, and can be best-enjoyed & travelled while based in the Village of Tunis. Kom el Dikka is a 30 year old privately owned Olive Farm, which has been recently developed into an Agri-Tourism Lodge. Several years ago, the farm added Vegetable & Fruit Organic Agriculture to its program to accommodate for the family's' and relatives needs, and has since expanded to include selling Certified organic products to Tunis Village and Cairo residence. Kom el Dikka accommodates guests in a few secluded locations on the hills of the estate overlooking Lake Qarun. All architecture is in Earth/Islamic design, which is both beautiful and functional, especially in managing hot and dry weather. Making it feel warmer in winter and cooler in summer than the outside temperature. Within the 45 acre estate of Kom el Dikka, and further around Tunis Village; you will find many different and interesting activities for you and even more for kids such as: Fruit & Vegetable Picking, Horseback riding, Bird watching, Petting Zoo, Hiking, Jogging, Sailing, Fishing, Duck Migration, Baking Bread, Pottery schools, Arts & Crafts, learning to plant, BMX Track, Mountain bike riding, Sports, and Boat rides in the lake.

location: Qarun Lake Touristic Road, Al Fayyum Egypt
description: On the tranquil side of Qarun lake in Fayoum – the oldest city in Egypt, the new 4 Star Byoum Lakeside Hotel has opened it's doors in September 2016. A fertile depression in Egypt's Western Desert, some 130 kilometers southwest of Cairo, Fayoum is both rich in history and outstanding in natural beauty. Byoum Lakeside Hotel is the ideal gateway resort for families wanting to relax by the swimming pool, discover the National Park or visit Fayoum city and its famous watermills. A beautiful and peaceful hotel where all rooms are facing the Qarun Lake, enjoying the greenery and bird watching from the terrace. Hotel rooms range from Classic rooms, Suites and large 2 bedrooms Grand Suites.

name: Tache Fayoum
location: Qarun Lake Touristic Road, Al Fayyum 63511 Egypt
description: قبل اي حاجه جزيل الشكر ل: استاذ/ محمد علي كامل- مدير المكان 01000776694 و استاذ/ محمود صالح - المسؤول عن الفندق 01098807700 و الشيف محمد و الأساتذة المحترمين الحلوين اللي ماسكين الفندق..  اللي عرفتوا انه كان بيت احمد ماهر باشا.. و فعلا المكان اكثر من رائع.. هدوء و راحه و استجمام.... اضافة لجمال الطبيعه.... و المنظر على بحيرة قارون...  المواعيد من ٧ صباحا ل ١٢ مساء الفطار فول و جبنه و طماطم و جبنه قديمه و عسل اسود و عسل نحل وطعمية و بيض على مزاجك  اما الفطير المشلتت غرقان سمنه تاكل منه و تدوب في حلاوته.. حاجه تحفه الغدا... اي حاجه عايزها موجوده... بس الفيوم يعني الطيور... البط و الحمام و الفراخ الشامورط و الخضار الطازه و الرز المفلفل و الملوخيه طعم تاني فعلا.. حمام السباحه نظيف و الحمامات و الشاور موجودين ولو عايز اوضه براحتك متواجد حسب اللي عايزينوا... كنت اتمنى اني ابات هناك....بس تتعوض المره الجايه لان اكيد في مره تانيه ان شاء الله... الف لشكر لناس منعرفهاش خلونا نقضي يوم حنتكلم عنه كتيررررررر…

name: Sobek Lodge
amenities: Free parking,Restaurant
location: Qaroun, Ibsheway, Faiyum Governorate, Egypt, Al Fayyum 00000 Egypt
description: We spent 2 nights at Sobek Lodge and were generally very happy with our time there. We had an enormous room with4 beds in it and everything was clean and comfortable. We struggled to get hot water in the bathroom, but this seems a common problem in Egypt. The hotel has attractive gardens with plenty of seating areas and a nice pool. There are several friendly cats and dogs who are willing to share the plentiful, tasty meals with visitors, but are in no way a nuisance. Situated right in the heart of Tunis village, there is easy access to local artisan workshops, ATMs and supermarkets.

name: Zad El Mosafer Ecolodge
amenities: Free parking,Outdoor pool,Restaurant
location: Tunis Village, Al Fayyum 11115 Egypt
description: This is the second year that me and my family ( 18 members) try their restaurant and I totally regret giving them a second chance. We ordered ducks and pigeons. The order took an hour and 20 minutes. You’d think it was worth the wait, nope. The duck was tasteless and very hard to chew, while the pigeons were a total disaster. They were barely cooked and each one was still bloody. Imagine my feeling when trying to reach the stuffed rice only to find the blood. Simply disgusting, I stopped myself from vomiting. We paid 2800 for this raw crap. Sorry Zad El Mosafer you’ve wasted ALL your Chances. NEVER AGAIN.

description: The Great Pyramid Inn Amidst in the first line opposite the Great Pyramids of Giza and Sphinx. The hotel located just a couple of more minutes walking distance from these wonders entrance gate, 30 minutes away driving from Saqqara Pyramid and the Egyptian Museum. Seek after secret gates of the ancient world through pharonic decorations in the hotel corridors, discover our unparalleled view of the pyramids while enjoying the magnificent sunrise or sunset plus free sound and light show from terrace restaurant and explore a new exceptional journey through history where Egyptian heritage meets luxurious European hospitality. It is the idyllic hideaway for sightseeing and relaxation. Kindly be informed that we provide free pick up service from the airport but only if you have two days reservation at least.

Breakfast is on rooftop and the Pyramids views are breathtaking. Hotel itself is in a great location, next to the Pyramids entrance and rooms are comfortable and clean. description: Although I would not advise staying overnight in Giza (it's much better to see Giza in its splendor during the day than at night, when you unfortunately run into a whole bunch of crazy traders and animal cruelty), the hotel is nice. The staff is very intrusive, sometimes even annoying with tips, but the rooms are big and mostly clean. Unfortunately, the internet did not work for two of the three days we spent there. Breakfast is pretty bad, but you get free water, tea and coffee. The absolute biggest advantage of the hotel is the view from the top. I will never forget such a beautiful scene.

location: Hadaik Al Ahram 201 W, Giza 12611 Egypt
description: Finding an ideal romantic hotel in Cairo does not have to be difficult. Welcome to Desert Moon, a nice option for travelers like you. Rooms at Desert Moon offer a flat screen TV, air conditioning, and a minibar providing exceptional comfort and convenience, and guests can go online with free wifi. A new entrance to the pyramids is in walking distance just across the street and the new Grand Museum is only 5km away. Desert Moon looks forward to welcoming you on your visit to Cairo.

name: Life Pyramids Inn
amenities: Bottled water,Safe,Soundproof rooms,Private check-in / check-out,Airport transportation,Free High Speed Internet (WiFi)
location: 5 Safi El-Din Street, Giza 12557 Egypt
description: If I could award the Life Pyramids Inn 2 one hundred stars I would. The accommodation is spotless with comfortable beds and a good strong shower. Our host and owner, Mohammed, was welcoming and so incredibly helpful with tips and advice on everything you could possibly need. This is a wonderful gem of a hotel which is family run. Mohammed’s mother cleans the room every day and cooks up the most delicious Egyptian breakfasts. Sam, Mohammeds brother, is a delightful host too and always quick to hand out bottled water.  And as for the view from the terrace…breathtaking! You have a clear unobstructed view of the great pyramids which is literally minutes away. I could never tire of this view and actually felt very emotional when I caught my first glimpse. Every day Mohammed checks in with you to make sure you are having the best possible experience. He is funny, friendly and we all got along famously. Mohammed has a fiend and driver called Deesha who we used nearly every day. His English, like Mohammed’s, is very good and he also has a great sense of humour - he’s also a safe and excellent driver which is essential in Egypt!  I have always wanted to see the pyramids so as a birthday treat, my husband obliged. On the night in question, Mohammed, Sam and his mother presented me with the most delicious birthday cake which he later shared with all the other guests. This is so typical of this lovely family. As seasoned travellers this holiday is one that stands out the most. The rich ancient history, the views, museums and mosque (Mohammed Ali Pasha) visit to the fabulous Khan el-Kalili market, the list goes on. But what made the difference was staying with Mohammed and his family and friend.…
